Posts.Content: Forgot to say my sentinel lymph node and one other were removed
Posts.Title: Radio active dye during lymph node removal

Posts.Content: I had the dye injected on the operating table when I was under anaesthetic. On the same day, before that I had radioactive injection into the site
Posts.Title: Radio active dye during lymph node removal

Posts.Content: Morning Winky Like you I dreaded the start of rt. it’ll be a breeze everyone told me compared to chemo and lumpectomy. I knew that but it was going into the unknown. Anyway with lots of nervy moments all in all my 20 sessions went ok, max time 15 minutes to less than 10 minutes each session. Radiographers would play music and talk to me during each session which helped me massively to relax. I remember my very last session and boy did I have a right old cry when it’d finished Good luck Val
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm on weekly taxol too, 2nd one yesterday, but not with Herceptin.  Touch wood I've no hair loss yet and my chemo nurse said that with the weekly it will probably only thin, could the Herceptin be making it fall out ?  I'm not that clued up on it all but I do have 2 wigs ready as after my 12 sessions I then start 4 sessions of FEC and my hair will fall out
Posts.Title: 12 weekly Taxol hair loss

Posts.Content: Same here Rach, I'm in my pjs now, can't wait to get my bra off and feel free
Posts.Title: I had lumpectomy mid Dec 16 for DCIS grade 2 no lymph nodes involved...

Posts.Content: I've received one too
Posts.Title: Friend request

Posts.Content: I agree with you whole heartily.  My hair has started to grow back from last chemo end may.  I even got a letter asking to join the shave.  No thank you !  My husband is gobsmacked too and we both cringe and look away when it's on, too painful personally and he rightly says donations are made without this type of advert
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi Sue62 Sorry to hear the problem you have with your picc. I had a port but unfortunately got a bad infection and eventually had it removed. Only lasted for 4 chemo sessions too, I was gutted as it made blood tests and chemo so much easier All the best Val
Posts.Title: Hickman line vs Port

Posts.Content: Hi Sue The rest of my treatment which was 4 weekly Taxol left and then 4 sessions of EC was by cannula.  My chemo nurse used the same vein each time with no problems. My bloods were taken lower down from the vein so it could still be used for the chemo.  I was very lucky and had no problems  Val
Posts.Title: Hickman line vs Port

Posts.Content: Another one I thought of, a slush puppy, crushed ice with a juice flavour
Posts.Title: Aversion to liquid! Help!

Posts.Content: Hi JoDec What about watermelon
Posts.Title: Aversion to liquid! Help!

Posts.Content: Hi Shepherdess Sorry to hear of your phobia.  Have you thought about taking diazepam or similar from your GP.  I know how you feel, it’s fight or flight.  I suffered before my diagnosis with panic attacks and agoraphobia.  My god did I need help fast, travelling, operation ( never ever had one before ), then the chemo, then radiotherapy.  Cut the long story short, i took a 2mg tablet before every treatment whatever it was.  My surgeon, anaesthetist, oncologist all approved it too.  It became my saviour, made me more calm, still felt nervous but was able to go through all the treatments.  Haven’t taken or needed any since Go and see your GP Take care, all the best Val
Posts.Title: Scared of needles

Posts.Content: Although I haven’t experienced the op, Sloggi do a good range and also Playtex, both cotton All the best Val
Posts.Title: Underwear woes after diep flap

Posts.Content: Thinking of you Fran, chin up mate, so many new drugs now, stay positive. As for your husband, mmmm, stay strong and endure no crap !!!!!! Love and wishes  Val
Posts.Title: Update on my cancer

Posts.Content: I feel badly let down by friends and my sister.  They would ask how I was through my daughters or on bloody Facebook, which I don’t use, but never to my face or over the phone. I felt, ffs !!!  I’ve got breast cancer not a ruddy cold or infected limb.  Then through all treatment, which I’ve now finished, nothing’s changed. My sister lives 5 minutes away, I’ve always helped her, financially, support, had her living with us too in the past. We used to shop regularly, even that stopped. We did though about a month ago. I picked her up and the drive to shopping centre was all about her, 30 minutes. My hubby told me to be light hearted as if nothing was wrong, but I was boiling up. We parked. Then went to costa. I went in to order and pay. Got coffees. Someone had to open the door for me as we were sitting outside, she sat there as I struggled. Anyway as we started to drink I said “oh by the way I’m fine, thanks for asking”.  Give me time she said. I’ve seen her once since and that’s because it was hubbys birthday. I feel so let down. So alone and uncared for by her and my friends.  I don’t want sympathy but “ how are you feeling “ would be lovely to hear. I’ve been told to forget it but it’s something I can’t forget nor forgive . They are selfish. Why should they be frightened, it’s us that’s going or have been through this crap. We didn’t ask for it and I hope to god they never have to either So sorry but your post has touched my heart Love to us all, and I’d like to ask you all “ how are you feeling “,  it doesn’t take much does it, 4 little words Val
Posts.Title: Is it just me? - I'm just ranting really ;)

Posts.Content: Hi Little Wombat I had a rant yesterday and expressed my sadness and yes, bloody fury at my sisters lack of interest and friends in this post.  And I just really wanted to be asked “how are you feeling”.  Today it’s been so bubbling away inside me.  In fact I’m feeling so emotional and am doubting myself now, like I’ve turned people away from asking me. Because I was strong, pretty fit during treatments and just got on with it all, this I think led them to believe I was invincible.  Tomorrow is my granddaughter ‘s birthday party. Other years my sister has hitched a lift with me. Not this year, haven’t heard nothing. Today at work my daughter said my sister was going and helping out. Oh I said I’ve heard nothing from her. Well my daughter said, have you texted her, yes I said I texted her last week, did she reply, I said yes. And she gave me one of her looks and then told me all of my sisters news. I feel, and now I’m welling up, because I’ve finished treatment theyve forgot it now and even my husband, whose been so supportive doesn’t ask nor do 3 of my 4 grown up married kids.  Like you cancers not mentioned, wiped and hidden away but it’s not for us. We remember a certain appointment,what happened, we remember our bodies being prodded and injected and feeling ill, so ill and sore and in pain.  I can’t forget, I’ve tried.  And all I want is for them to ask me how I’m feeling, that’s all. Im so so sorry for this long rant again everyone, maybe it’s a form of healing, I don’t know.   Sorry Val
Posts.Title: Is it just me? - I'm just ranting really ;)

Posts.Content: Hi Lesley, good idea, I’m not on Facebook but will do a friend request on here, I hope I do it right, it’ll show your end at mail I think Val
Posts.Title: Is it just me? - I'm just ranting really ;)

Posts.Content: Thanks for getting back Little Wombat and I really don’t know what we can do. My 4 kids range from 25 to 39. During treatment I carried on with the normal housework and all that entails. Cooking, cleaning, washing, ironing, clearing up dog shit in the garden. My husband did hoover and make tea or coffee and he came to every appointment, but....... Youngest daughter did my ironing twice. I carried on working in the family business doing the payroll. Even going to the bank for the firm too. Perhaps I gave the wrong impression,that it was easy peezy, so I didn’t need the attention. I don’t know, I really don’t  Val
Posts.Title: Is it just me? - I'm just ranting really ;)

Posts.Content: Hi Lesley Physically and medically I’m doing very well.  Thank you Lesley, so very kind to ask, oh and don’t worry, never again will I put her first.  I can never forget Love and best wishes to you all  Val
Posts.Title: Is it just me? - I'm just ranting really ;)

Posts.Content: Just sent a friend request Lesley Val
Posts.Title: Is it just me? - I'm just ranting really ;)

Posts.Content: Well done Louby and I wish you a healthy and fun future!   Snap re nipple, mines exactly as you explained yours and underneath the boob too, hot weather didn't help either. I finish my radiotherapy tomorrow and like you, from being diagnosed last July, lumpectomy, chemo and rt all done and dusted, I can't believe how I've come through it with my humour still in tact lol ! Wishing you well Val
Posts.Title: Treatment finished :-)

Posts.Content: I kept mine on, they had no preference. The temperature is always cooler in the rt room. I remember going through rt in June this year when the weather was boiling, hard to remember we had some sort of a summer, the room was gorgeouslay cool.  The machines are probably heat sensitive and hav to remain cool
Posts.Title: Silly radiotherapy question -

Posts.Content: Hi Louby, lol, I started crying last Wednesday when I began 5 booster rt's.  My hair is growing , about 1 1/2 inches long and it's covering my head which was once bald, not sure of colour it will end up though. I'm 62 so will probably turn grey, back to hairdressers when long enough to get it coloured, which I can't wait to do.  Yours will grow with a flourish I have no doubt.   Take care of yourself and think of me tomorrow morning 9.30ish blubbering on the rt bed and making a mess of my mascara with tears ( and I have eyelashes too ) lol ! Love Val
Posts.Title: Treatment finished :-)

Posts.Content: Morning Louby All done and dusted.  Cried on the rt bed as I predicted I would, lol ! Relief, emotional I really don't know how to describe.  Bloody marvellous though Love Val
Posts.Title: Treatment finished :-)

Posts.Content: I’ve got the M & S Tshirt post surgery bras.  So comfortable
Posts.Title: Post surgery bra sale online M&S

Posts.Content: Hi Sacha I kept my hair through 12 weeks of Paclitaxol but on the 2nd Ec out of 4 it came out. Didn’t shave it but had it trimmed short and wore my wig.  I finished chemo end of May and within one month it was growing, even eye lashes, eyebrows and unfortunately body hair too, could have done without that, lol. Anyway I’m now nearly 5 months and have had a trim to tidy up and get a shape. It’s thick now, curly on top and straight back and sides which have been shaped around my ears.  Colour is a selection of greys but that’s ok and have had compliments on the style, which has really pleased me.  It’s also made me lazy as I just wash condition and leave to dry naturally. Before it was hairdryer and straighteners. Happy days !!!!! Val
Posts.Title: Hair or no hair ,

Posts.Content: Hi, I laughed and laughed reading these posts re chemo brain.  I know I did some stupid things when I was going through chemo but for the life of me I've forgotten what ! Again chemo brain 4 months since finishing, lol !!!
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain !

Posts.Content: I know, I fell apart when during pre op assessment she told me that’s where I’d have to go.  Hospital where I had chemo was 15 minutes from where I live so that was ok. My gp prescribed the diazepam and oncologist okayed it as safe to take.  I had 4 x ec and my side effects were minimal too You can do it, love and best wishes  Val
Posts.Title: Chemo induced anxiety & depression

Posts.Content: Hi Little Boo Boo I was a nervous wreck, suffering from panic attacks for many many years, unable to travel more than 5 miles from home. Boy cancer diagnosis certainly healed me mentally and.  I went to my doctors prior to lumpectomy and got diazepam to take on day of operation, had to travel 40, that’s right 40 miles to have the ratio active injection into boob, then travel back to Windsor for op. I did it. Then for chemo, again a diazepam before each session, my oncologist okayed it and that’s how I got through 6 months of chemo, a 2mg tablet was my support. Haven’t taken them since Best wishes  Val
Posts.Title: Chemo induced anxiety & depression

Posts.Content: Hi GeorgieCC Same as you, right hip and a limp as well lol
Posts.Title: First chemotherapy drugs

Posts.Content: I had EC too x 4, finished my chemo nearly 4 weeks ago, hooray ! I couldn't inject myself nor could my hubby, both wimps so Chemo nurse did it day after chemo.  The only side effects I had was joint pain in hip and base of spine.  Oncologist told me that was the bone marrow regenerating so just took paracetamols which helped, didn't go on for too long.  Hopefully you will be ok.  All the best
Posts.Title: First chemotherapy drugs
